summary: This document is a daily lieutenant's log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, NY, dated August 5, 2019. It details routine prison operations, inmate counts, and security checks across three shifts (Morning, Day, and Evening Watch). The log notes an inmate on suicide watch and another on psychological observation, and records the movement of several inmates for court, hospital, and new commitments.

events.title: Routine Prison Operations Log
events.description: Standard daily log of the Metropolitan Correctional Center detailing inmate counts, security checks, equipment inventories, and inmate movements across three shifts.

events.title: Inmate Placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: The Day Watch log notes an inmate is on suicide watch with an inmate companion.

events.title: Inmates Placed in Administrative Detention
events.description: Inmates Butler and Eke were placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) pending an SIS (Special Investigative Services) investigation.

events.title: Inmate Taken to Court
events.description: Inmate Diaz was taken out to court and later returned.

events.title: New Inmate Commitments
events.description: Inmates Kilgore, Baez-Pena, and Townzen were newly committed to the facility's Receiving and Discharge (RA) unit.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: This is a routine prison operations log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York dated August 5, 2019, the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The log notes an inmate was on suicide watch and another on psychological observation, but does not name Jeffrey Epstein or any high-profile individuals.
Inmates Butler and Eke were placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) pending an SIS investigation.
The log records standard procedures including inmate counts, security checks, and the malfunction of the public address system preventing PREA announcements.
The document is significant as it provides a snapshot of routine operations at the MCC on a date proximate to a major event, but contains no direct references to the Epstein case.
